newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombian stocks end lower, led by banks, cement.
newsitem.headline: Colombian stocks end lower, led by banks, cement.

text.p: Colombian stocks, led by bank and cement issues, closed slightly lower on Tuesday as investors adjusted their positions before the end of the month, traders said.
"The markets always dip at the end of the month as investors take profits in order to square their financial obligations," a trader said.
Bogota's IBB price index fell 0.26 percent to 1,190.72 on turnover of 4.3 billion pesos. Medellin's IBOMED general price index dipped 0.12 percent to 18,142.69 on turnover of 4.7 billion pesos.
Banco de Bogota SA finished down 2.1 percent at 6,750 in Bogota and 3.5 percent lower at 6,750 in Medellin.
Compania de Cemento Argos SA closed down 0.37 percent at 8,420 in Medellin on a 1.9 billion pesos pocket-to-pocket cross deal, and down a wafer-thin 0.01 percent to 8,400 in Bogota.
Brewer Bavaria SA was the most active Bogota stock, closing up a slim 0.12 percent to 8,215, but holding steady at 8,200 in Medellin.
Banco Industrial Colombiano SA held steady at 3,900 in Bogota.
